name: Introduction to Psychology
description: This course provides an overview of the major sub-disciplines of psychology and introduces students to psychological theories and research.

name: Developmental Psychology
description: This course examines the psychological development of individuals from infancy through adulthood, focusing on the physical, cognitive, and social development.

name: Social Psychology
description: This course examines how people think, interact, and behave in social contexts, exploring the influence of interpersonal and group dynamics on individual behavior.

name: Cognitive Psychology
description: This course examines how people perceive, process, and remember information, exploring topics such as attention, memory, language, decision-making, and problem-solving.

name: Statistics for Psychology
description: This course provides an introduction to the use of statistical methods in psychological research, including data analysis, graphical presentation, and the interpretation of results.

name: Experimental Psychology
description: This course provides an introduction to the basic principles of experimental design, data collection, and data analysis in psychology research.
